titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Early 20th century Brooklyn postcard collection V1988.054
titlestmt.author: Patricia Glowinski
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:20:51 +0000.

physdesc.extent: 63 items contained in one postcard box.

did.abstract: The Early 20th century Brooklyn postcard collection is comprised of 63 picture and photographic postcards, dating from circa 1900 to 1949, depicting various scenes in Brooklyn. The postcards are both in color and black-and-white. Some of the postcards retain their original postage stamps and include correspondence from the sender. Images of bridges, schools, churches, houses, monuments, hotels, and Prospect Park, among others, are included.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Early 20th century Brooklyn postcard collection is comprised of 63 picture and photographic postcards, dating from circa 1900 to 1949, depicting various scenes in Brooklyn. The postcards are both in color and black-and-white. Some of the postcards retain their original postage stamps and include correspondence from the sender. Images of bridges, schools, churches, houses, monuments, hotels, and Prospect Park, among others, are included.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The collection was purchased by the Brooklyn Historical Society, date unknown. The collection was formally accessioned in 1988.
